publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3613 John Farquhar Munro: Skye Bridge Tolls—That the Parliament recognises that toll charges on the Skye Bridge of £5.70 for non-ticket book holders are vastly higher than other bridges; notes that the Napier University Transport Research Institute report An Assessment of the Economic Impact of the Skye Bridge Tolls shows that the tolls are having a negative effect on the Skye and Lochalsh economy, and calls for the tolls to be removed entirely or at least reduced in line with the toll regimes on other Scottish bridges.
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Irene McGugan*

S1M-3613 John Farquhar Munro: Skye Bridge Tolls—That the Parliament recognises that toll charges on the Skye Bridge of £5.70 for non-ticket book holders are vastly higher than other bridges; notes that the Napier University Transport Research Institute report An Assessment of the Economic Impact of the Skye Bridge Tolls shows that the tolls are having a negative effect on the Skye and Lochalsh economy, and calls for the tolls to be removed entirely or at least reduced in line with the toll regimes on other Scottish bridges. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Christine Grahame*, Shona Robison*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Alex Neil*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Brian Adam*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-3613 Skye Bridge Tolls (lodged on 20 November 2002) Andrew Wilson*
